Package model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
model.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
AiPlayer
public class Player extends Object
Represents a player in the game.

A player has a hand of cards, an account with information about the player, an alias, and a unique game id. The player can also be in a state of "uno safe" where they are protected from being called out for not calling "uno" when they have only one card left in their hand.

See Also:
  • Account
  • Card

  • Method Details

    • clearIds

      public static void clearIds()
      Resets the player id counter to 0.

      This method is used to reset the player id counter to 0. This is useful if the game needs to be reset or if the counter needs to be reset for any other reason.

    • getValidMoves

      public List<Card> getValidMoves(Card lastDiscard)
      Returns a list of valid moves for the player.

      A move is valid if the card played has the same value as the last discarded card, or the same color, or it is a wild card.

      Parameters:
      lastDiscard - the last card discarded by another player
      Returns:
      a list of valid cards the player can play
      See Also:
      • Card

    • setUnoSafe

      public void setUnoSafe(boolean unoSafe)
      Sets the uno safe flag for the player.

      The uno safe flag indicates whether the player has called "UNO" and therefore is protected from being called out for failing to do so.

      Parameters:
      unoSafe - the value to set the uno safe flag to
